SENT.plain: Aneurysms of lenticulostriate artery (LSA) have rarely been reported
We present an extremely rare case of bilateral aneurysm of LSA, which spontaneously disappeared
A 59-year-old man presented to us with a decreased level of consciousness
Twice repeated blood culture was negative
Computed tomography (CT) showed bilateral basal ganglia hemorrhage with intraventricular extension and acute hydrocephalus
Cerebral angiograms, on 3 days after the onset, disclosed two aneurysms on the left LSA and one aneurysm on the right LSA
Cerebral angiography after 9 weeks demonstrated complete disappearance of three aneurysms
